result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Charlene M Bickford

defendant.name: Bickford, Charlene M

records.addlTxt:
11:30 AM Defendant Charlene M Bickford appeared by video.  Attorney Karl Peter Hayes in court for State of Wisconsin. Court speaks to the public defender's office search for appointment. Court will be assisting in finding an appointment. Bond continued.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for December 12, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Public Defender Status of Counsel Report - 1,489 contacts

10:50 AM Defendant Charlene M Bickford appeared by phone without counsel.  ADA Dennis Brown in court for State of Wisconsin. Court notes public defender efforts. Bond continued.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 11:30 am.

10:29 AM Defendant Charlene M Bickford appeared by video without counsel.  Attorney Karl Peter Hayes in court for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant confirms complaint.  Court reads charges. Public Defender Office still looking for counsel.  Bond continued.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant appears by video from the Vilas County Jail without counsel.  ADA Dennis Brown appears for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant confirms receipt of criminal complaint.  Cash bond set at $150.00.  Conditions:  Absolute sobriety. Initial appearance set for 8/15/2022 @ 10:15 a.m.
